text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-mjuoQ5U8iEU/VFtk3_nU9wI/AAAAAAAAygc/KewWJr9AEbI/s1600/huu.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"380\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-mjuoQ5U8iEU/VFtk3_nU9wI/AAAAAAAAygc/KewWJr9AEbI/s1600/huu.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We in Kerala have NOT\nforgotten the ancient Hindu culture.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shraadham ritual wherein our dead ancestors\nare remembered with GRATITUDE, love and nostalgia is one of the most important.\n&nbsp;The greatness of Hindu festivals and\nrituals is that GRATITUDE is woven into everything .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Karkidaka Vavu Bali is\nsimilar to that of Pitru Paksha Shraadh.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both days are new moon\ndays ( amavasya ) and dead ancestor rituals are done as per Sanatana Dharma .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Amavasya in Sanskrit\nand Malayalam means new moon night in Sanskrit.&nbsp;\nThe word Amavasya is common to almost all Indian languages.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\">Pitru means ancestors\nand Paksha means 15 day waning lunar period. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hindus pay homage to their ancestors by\noffering Shraddha and Tarpan. &nbsp;&nbsp;The new moon\nday ( amavasya ) &nbsp;is most important .<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pitru Paksha days are\nconsidered inauspicious by Hindus. Only death rites can be performed in these\ndays.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was the white\nChristian invader who made Sunday a holiday for Indians. &nbsp;&nbsp;Before Amavasya day was a holiday for the\nwhole of India, as important Hindu obsequies and rites &nbsp;were done at home and in temples. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;You must know that Christianity &nbsp;( 2000 years old ) and Islam ( 1300 years old\n) are very recent religions, while Sanatana Dharma is 30,000 years old.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The internet is full of\nbull about this event . &nbsp;So listen up .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The performance of\nShraddha <span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">by a son </span>during Pitru Paksha is regarded as compulsory by Hindus, to\nensure that the soul of the ancestor goes to heaven. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Why son ? &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Why not daughter?&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">It has a lot to do with the <b><span style=\"color: red;\">Y chromosome </span></b>, kept alive by the wise Maharishis &nbsp;- - modern science will understand all this only after 100 years .</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Markandeya Purana says that if the ancestors\nare content with the shraddhas, they will bestow health and happiness &nbsp;upon the performer. However let it be known\nthat the underlying emotion is gratitude and NOT selfisness .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ritual in\nremembrance of one's ancestors is known as Shraadh. It can be done at home .\nHowever Hindus prefer to visit holy river ghats to do this . &nbsp;After the ritual we feed poor people and give\ncharity.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many scriptures tell to feed minimum two Brahmins \u2013that is only\nbecause Brahmins were poor ( except in Kerala ) .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Muslims tell everybody in an\nunsolicited manner that their religion prescribed charity. My own father's shraadh was done here .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch- GAYA WIKIPEDIA <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You can see this immoral\nLIE. This story was unknown to Indians till the white invader came to India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE:&nbsp; Gaya is significant to Hindus from the point\nof view of salvation to the souls of ancestors (a ritual called pinda daan).\nAccording to Ramayana, Lord Rama came to Gaya along with Sita for pitripaksha\n(or to perform pindadanam). While Lord Rama had gone to have his bath before\noffering this pindadanam, his father King Dasharath's hands appeared and a\nvoice spoke to Sita asking her to offer the pindam herself, as the King was\nvery hungry. Moved by this, Sita prepared pindams out of sand, and offered them\nherself to the hands that appeared to receive them. After some time, Lord Rama\ncame back and started performing the rites. When it was time to give the\npindadanam, he was surprised and pained to see his father's not receiving it.\nSita then explained what had occurred. She called for the river Phalgu, a\nBrahman standing nearby, cow, and a banyan tree nearby as a witness to this\nmiraculous occurrence. Except for the banyan tree that supported her, rest of\nthem denied her story - Brahman had a greed for more money as offerings, river\nPhalgu in a wish to receive more offerings from Lord Rama, and the cow in awe\nof the Lord. So, Sita cursed the three liars. Ramayana states that on account\nof this curse, Phalgu River lost its water, and the river is simply a vast\nstretch of sand dunes. At the same time Sita blessed a banyan tree to be\nimmortal.:&nbsp; UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So cow is a BAAAAD\nanimal OK?&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Indian must now kill all them BAAAAD cows who told BAAAD lie to Sita Maiyya . font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I did my shraddh for my\nmother at Kaveri river ghats Karnataka. There were too many monkeys around \u2013just\ntoo many. I asked one very old man who was selling dharbha grass, how the\nmonkeys landed up at the shraadh ghats \u2014he said the British put them there at\nthe huge banyan tree . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When I had to put the\npindam balls , there was NO way the monkeys would NOT eat it. There were many\nothers who just watched the monkeys eat it. &nbsp;I saw someone feeding to a dog-and I shouted\nat him . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anyway, I took my\npindam ( rice and sesame balls ) walked barefeet and naked chested ( with wet\ndhoti ) about 50 metres away and then put it on a high ledge. Then I clapped my\nhands and I was so happy to see a raven ( symbolizing the spirit of my mother )\nalighting on it and gorging on it. &nbsp;If\nthe mangy monkeys had eaten it I would have been disturbed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Later I did some research\nand found out that the immoral white man has written that as per Hindu\nscriptures the pindam balls can also be given to a dog or a cow\u2014which is an\nIMMORAL lie. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Getting back to the\nravens. In the tower of London lies the Kohinoor diamond of Lord Krishna.</span>\nT<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ill\n150 years back, all diamonds on this planet came from India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Kohinoor diamond (\nSyamanthakam ) &nbsp;has a curse . font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">King George the Emperor of India was a misfit, terribly shy with a\nstutter. He would cry and was prone to extravant melancholy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>So what cried an optimist John Bull-- our king George VI may cry but his father no 5 , was so brave - he holds the world record for killing maximum INDIAN TIGERS WITH HIS BARE HANDS -</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-meW8hsqBLF8/VFhZa91w4CI/AAAAAAAAyUM/ndUxuDWc_qc/s1600/00000e3c_medDDFium.jpeg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"430\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-meW8hsqBLF8/VFhZa91w4CI/AAAAAAAAyUM/ndUxuDWc_qc/s1600/00000e3c_medDDFium.jpeg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: x-large;\">--some tigers he even killed with his prick !</b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-6UeteTFghRE/VFhZgGhKpOI/AAAAAAAAyUU/MC2xYuuhN7Y/s1600/M1DDF69426.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"432\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-6UeteTFghRE/VFhZgGhKpOI/AAAAAAAAyUU/MC2xYuuhN7Y/s1600/M1DDF69426.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Indians looking on with heavy hearts , &nbsp;while the white invader decimated our glorious tigers , the most beautiful animal on this planet --&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">BR Ambedkar and EVR Periyar did NOT want the white invader to leave India</span>. &nbsp; &nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">EVR Periyar even observed 15th Aug 1947 as a day of mourning. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">Karunanidhi wants to give Bharat Ratna to EVR Periyar</span>. &nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">BR Ambedkar is already Bharat Ratna.&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Hd44HffcAak/VFhayHfgmTI/AAAAAAAAyUg/q6Y7FcXSX8A/s1600/imagrhges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Z9_S11UcGOo/VFhbUJJyFEI/AAAAAAAAyUo/j4ZtMLNrFy0/s1600/downlffoad.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"358\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Z9_S11UcGOo/VFhbUJJyFEI/AAAAAAAAyUo/j4ZtMLNrFy0/s1600/downlffoad.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shraaddh is the rituals\nperformed during the end pf Pitru Paksha on new moon ( dark amavasya &nbsp;)day ,for the departed souls of dead\nancestors. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-_ykc9ev6rW8/VFhvWIXB44I/AAAAAAAAyVg/R1vXxe2LDgk/s1600/imfffages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"166\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-_ykc9ev6rW8/VFhvWIXB44I/AAAAAAAAyVg/R1vXxe2LDgk/s1600/imfffages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our ancient scriptures like\nAgni Purana, Garuda Purana and Matysa Purana say that the souls will attain\npeace by the Shraadh ritual.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1Q2CyB9ikZA/VFhtxr9hHuI/AAAAAAAAyVE/0dgi0LtuTiY/s1600/imaddeges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The male who performs\nthe shraaddh should take a purifying bath beforehand and is expected to wear a\ndhoti.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He wears a ring of DARBHA grass on the 4<sup>th</sup> finger of his right\nhand . &nbsp;&nbsp;Then the ancestors are invoked\nto reside in the ring. &nbsp;The shraaddh is\nusually performed bare-chested in dhoti while sitting on darbha grass.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ex9s1vcFlws/VFht9diry3I/AAAAAAAAyVM/7XGVLvsVdwE/s1600/downlwmoad.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"282\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ex9s1vcFlws/VFht9diry3I/AAAAAAAAyVM/7XGVLvsVdwE/s1600/downlwmoad.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During Samudra manthan\n, the fibres flaked off the back of the giant tortoise by churning of Mount\nMeru got mixed with Amrit drops and was swept ashore , from which Darbha grass\ngrew.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Darbha grass increase the\ntej &nbsp;( aura radiance ) .</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-bbGv5mQK5kY/VFhuFSryV8I/AAAAAAAAyVU/mR7Esf33YQo/s1600/7049003HGK_orig.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The deceased\nancestors (Pitars) absorb the energy of a specific level from the ritual .&nbsp; &nbsp;To put\nit in scientific terms , the darbha grass acts as a resonator while chanting\nmantras . .&nbsp; Energy in a vortex acts as a\nfrequency converter.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">'<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meaning: <i><span style=\"color: blue;\">For the\npurpose of shraddha of the Pitars, pluck the Darbha along with its root. The\nreason for this is that we can gain victory over the Pitruloka with the help of\nthe root of the Darbha.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Do not re-use second\nhand Darbha grass , as it has lost its potency.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-V1KlTsAUpO4/VFhyPxMTpYI/AAAAAAAAyVs/-IKf65QHvwc/s1600/imGREages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Do NOT pick up darbha fallen\non the path, &nbsp;kept on the funeral pyre, &nbsp;laid on the ground of sacrificial fire, &nbsp;already used as a seat in a shraddha ritual, &nbsp;used in the Brahmayadnya or for the purpose of\ntarpan.&nbsp;&nbsp; Pluck only green Darbha which\nis grown on a clean ground.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our scriptures specify\nthe &nbsp;mantra to be recited while plucking\nthe Darbha for shraddha:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ima\u1e41 badhn\u0101mi te ma\u1e47i\u1e41\nd\u012brgh\u0101yutv\u0101ya tejase |<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">darbha sa\u030dpatnadambhana\u1e41\ndvi\u1e63atastapana\u1e41 h\u1e5bda\u1e25 ||<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"I bind this\namulet on you with prayers for a vigorous, long life; the sacred darbha grass\nwhich quells enemies and destroys the opposition.\"&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0927\u0943\u0924\u093e\u0926\u0941\u0932\u094d\u0932\u0941\u092a\u094d\u0924\u094b</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Above: &nbsp;Offering of water to\ndeceased ancestors\u2019 souls (pitar) is called as Pitru tarpan.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>The funeral pyre must\nbe COMPULSORILY set alight by a son.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>The ash/ bone immersion\nceremony ( asti kriya ) must be COMPULSORILY done by a son.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>The first shraadham &nbsp;( death anniversary ) &nbsp;must be done by a male.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prayers offered at the\nend of the shraddha ritual<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A. font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During Kumbhabhi\u1e63ekam\nrituals ( &nbsp;Temple consecration rituals ),\nganges water is kept in kumbhas (water pots).&nbsp;\n&nbsp;The gods &nbsp;are invoked into the kumbhas and worshiped\nwith yantra puja ( Sri Yantra mystical diagrams), upacharas (ritual offerings)\nand homam ( havanam fire ceremony). &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This\nprocess energizes the water in the kumbhas, which is then used in a ritual bath\nto purify and energize (or re-energize) the Temple murtis (idols).&nbsp; &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">During\nthis process a thread is woven from darbha grass to connect the kumbha to the\nVigrahas (temple Idols).</span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During avahana ( invocation ) &nbsp;and pranapratishta (enlivement),\nthe kumbha , &nbsp;idol &nbsp;is touched with a darbha kurcha, while\nreciting the mantras of invocation.&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b>WE HINDUS HAVE THE RICHEST CULTURE ON THIS PLANET AND WE ARE PROUD OF IT. &nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meaning: How will a\nhouseholder who does <b>not</b> perform shraddha while the sun is stationed in the\nKanya, that is, Virgo sign and thereby invites the ire of the departed\nancestors, acquire wealth, son etc.? --&nbsp;&nbsp;\n<b>Mahabharata 4000 BC</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">They\nhave NOT&nbsp;yet appreciated that the Y chromosome is undergoing rapid evolutionary\ndeterioration.&nbsp;</span></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">India has very little damaged DNA and homosexuals/ criminals due\nto the Gotra system.</span><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many generations ago\nthe Y chromosome was large, and contained as many genes as the X chromosome.\nNow it is a fraction of its past size and contains fewer than 80 functional\ngenes. The the scientific world is sleeping and expecting others to wake them\nup .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many IDIOTS speculate that the Y\nchromosome has become superfluous and could completely decay within the next 10\nmillion years.&nbsp; Darwin never even knew\nabout DNA , leave alone Y chromosome.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nX and Y chromosomes, both of which derived from autosomes, were initially about\nthe same size.&nbsp; At some specific time\nalong the way, the Y chromosome gradually lost the ability to recombine - or\nexchange genetic information - with the X chromosome and began to evolve\nindependently.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Ay_YowRtJUU/VFjp6jUU6gI/AAAAAAAAya4/TnsI0gLGQQE/s1600/downloadftyuio.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"300\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Ay_YowRtJUU/VFjp6jUU6gI/AAAAAAAAya4/TnsI0gLGQQE/s1600/downloadftyuio.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This quickly led to a catastrophic deterioration of the Y\nchromosome, which now contains only 3 percent of the genes that it once shared\nwith the X chromosome.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For most genes on the\nX-chromosome, only one copy is required. &nbsp;Females have two X chromosomes and therefore\ntwo copies of every X-linked gene, so one copy is randomly inactivated, or\nturned off. Males have only one X chromosome and therefore only one copy is\nexpressed. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, regulatory\ngenes are often dosage-dependent and haplo-insufficient, i.e., two copies of\nthe gene are required and the presence of only one copy can lead to\nabnormalities or disease. &nbsp;In females,\nthese regulatory genes escape X-inactivation so that the copy on the second X\nchromosome is also expressed; in males, who only have one X chromosome, the\npreservation of this group of regulatory genes on the Y chromosome is crucial\nfor providing the second copy. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-wIvn88p9RF8/VFjpkYuS-oI/AAAAAAAAyao/UjCK5ebJHA4/s1600/imaerhges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"272\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-wIvn88p9RF8/VFjpkYuS-oI/AAAAAAAAyao/UjCK5ebJHA4/s1600/imaerhges.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<o:p></o:p><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Overall, what this\nmeans is that beyond its role in sex determination and fertility, the Y\nchromosome also contains important genes that are critical for the health and\nsurvival of males.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mammals possess two sex\nchromosomes; X and Y. &nbsp;&nbsp;Normal females\nhave two X chromosomes, whereas males have one X and one Y. &nbsp;These chromosomes evolved from non-sex\nchromosomes, called autosomes, over the last 300 million years. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During this time the Y\nchromosome experienced a spectacular rate of decay, losing 97% of its ancestral\ngenes, leaving a rather dwarfed remnant containing less than 100 genes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The X chromosome on the\nother hand retains 98% of its ancestral genes and has today around 2000 genes. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Y chromosome plays a HUGE\nrole in human race survival. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The all-important Y\nchromosome \u2014 only present in men, and the genes contained on the Y chromosome\nhave mostly been associated with sex determination and sperm production. But\nlet me tell you that the Y chromosome also influences lifespan in men. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-vgyfs9Kklpg/VFjpvdpk8HI/AAAAAAAAyaw/gWjyptzZT8U/s1600/inheritance.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-vgyfs9Kklpg/VFjpvdpk8HI/AAAAAAAAyaw/gWjyptzZT8U/s1600/inheritance.gif\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Men who had lost the Y\nchromosome in a large proportion of their blood cells had a lower survival,\nirrespective of cause of death. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There\nis a &nbsp;correlation between loss of the Y\nchromosome and risk of cancer mortality, Y chromosome has a role in tumour\nsuppression \u2013 reason why men get cancer more often than women.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Y Chromosome is the\nonly Chromosome which gets passed down only between the men in a lineage.&nbsp; Women never get this Y Chromosome in their\nbody.&nbsp; And hence Y Chromosome plays a\ncrucial role in modern genetics in identifying the Genealogy ie male ancestry\nof a person.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A mother will pass\neither her mother\u2019s X Chromosome to her Children or her father\u2019s X Chromosome\nto her children or a combination of both because of both her X Chromosomes\ngetting mixed (called as Crossover).&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On\nthe other hand, a Son always gets his father\u2019s Y Chromosome and that too almost\nintact without any changes because there is no corresponding another Y\nchromosome in his cells to do any mixing as his combination is XY, while that\nof females is XX which hence allows for mixing as both are X Chromosomes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Y Chromosome is\nalways preserved throughout a male lineage (Father \u2013 Son&nbsp; -&nbsp;\nGrandson etc) because a Son always gets it from his father, while the X\nChromosome is not preserved in the female lineage (Mother, Daughter, Grand\nDaughter etc) because it comes from both father and mother.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the initial\nembryonic cell has XY chromosome, the female attributes get suppressed by the\ngenes in the Y Chromosome and the embryo develops into a male child. Since only\nmen have Y Chromosomes, son always gets his Y Chromosome from his father and\nthe X Chromosome from his mother. On the other hand daughters always get their\nX Chromosomes, one each from both father and mother.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>The Gotra system was designed to track down the root Y\nChromosome of a person quite easily.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Our Vedic seers had observed the degeneration of the Y Chromosome\nand they wanted to maintain as many individual healthy unique Y Chromosome\nlineages as possible.&nbsp;</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></span></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; So in all we have 46 Chromosomes in\nevery cell, of which 23 come from the mother and 23 from the father.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u0928</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u092a\u094d\u0930\u092e\u0926\u093f\u0924\u0935\u094d\u092f\u092e</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">-\nTaittiriya Upanishad 1.11- &nbsp;5000BC<o:p></o:p></span></b></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meaning: &nbsp;<span style=\"color: blue;\">One should not commit mistakes in any task\nperformed towards God or ancestors' souls. One should not avoid these rituals</span>.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Performing Shraddha is\na part of obeying Dharma, as per science of Sanatana Dharma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">-\nShrimadbhagwatgita 1.42 -4000 BC<o:p></o:p></span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meaning: <span style=\"color: blue;\">&nbsp;Due to the nonperformance of rituals like\npinda shraddha and offering water to deceased ancestors etc, the ancestors of\nsuch people (who do not perform Shraaddh) have to reside in the lower gross\nenergy planes &nbsp;. &nbsp;This results in stagnation and erosion of the\ndescendants .</span><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">Below: &nbsp;There is a loka ( ether\nspace)&nbsp; between Vaikunta ( 7th and\nhighest plane ) and earth called Pitru loka ( first 6 plane ) ruled by<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"> death\ngod Yama.</span>&nbsp; There is NO hell concept in\nHinduism.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pitru Paksha emphasises\nthe fact that the ancestors and the current generation and their next unborn\ngeneration are connected by blood ties. &nbsp;&nbsp;The current generation repays their debt to\nthe ancestors in the Pitru Paksha. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
